docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 12--The 3,771-ton German freighter Wakama, which sailed from Rio de Janeiro last midnight with a rich cargo, was scuttled by her crew off the Brazilian coast today to avoid capture, sailors of the British cruiser Hawkins...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 12--The 3,771-ton German freighter Wakama, which sailed from Rio de Janeiro last midnight with a rich cargo, was scuttled by her crew off the Brazilian coast today to avoid capture, sailors of the British cruiser Hawkins said on their arrival here tonight.
docs.abstract: Brit cruiser Hawkins repts German freighter Wakama scuttled herself to avoid capture off Brazil

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 13 (AP)--The story of the British  Navy's pounce upon the richly laden German freighter Wakama as she tried to slip through the sea blockade yesterday was told today by Rear Admiral Sir Henry Harwood, commander of British...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 13 (AP)--The story of the British Navy's pounce upon the richly laden German freighter Wakama as she tried to slip through the sea blockade yesterday was told today by Rear Admiral Sir Henry Harwood, commander of British forces in the South Atlantic.

docs.snippet: A competition is raging behind the scenes as to whether Arturo Toscanini or Leopold Stokowski, two of the foremost conductors in America, will lead a symphony orchestra from this country on a good-will tour of South America next Summer, it became...
docs.lead_paragraph: A competition is raging behind the scenes as to whether Arturo Toscanini or Leopold Stokowski, two of the foremost conductors in America, will lead a symphony orchestra from this country on a good-will tour of South America next Summer, it became known last night.

docs.snippet: BERLIN, Feb. 14--The German Government, in a note made public here tonight simultaneously with its delivery by the German Charge d'Affaires in Panama, rejects the protest of the American republics that followed the naval battle in Uruguayan waters...
docs.lead_paragraph: BERLIN, Feb. 14--The German Government, in a note made public here tonight simultaneously with its delivery by the German Charge d'Affaires in Panama, rejects the protest of the American republics that followed the naval battle in Uruguayan waters last December.
